body.p: The nic-mappings configuration object is used to ensure that the network device name used by the operating system always maps to the same physical device. A nic-mapping is associated to a server in the server definition file. (see Servers). Devices should be named hedN to avoid name clashes with any other devices configured during the operating system install as well as any interfaces that are not being managed by . An excerpt from nic_mappings.yml illustrates:
body.codeblock:
--- product: version: 2
nic-mappings:
- name: HP-DL360-4PORT physical-ports: - logical-name: hed1 type: simple-port bus-address: "0000:07:00.0"
- logical-name: hed2 type: simple-port bus-address: "0000:08:00.0"
- logical-name: hed3 type: multi-port bus-address: "0000:09:00.0" port-attributes: port-num: 0
- logical-name: hed4 type: multi-port bus-address: "0000:09:00.0" port-attributes: port-num: 1
body.p: Each entry in the nic-mappings list has the following attributes:

row.entry: An administrator-defined name for the mapping. This name may be used in a server definition (see Servers) to apply the mapping to that server.
A list containing device name to address mapping information.

body.p: Each entry in the physical-ports list has the following attributes:

row.entry: The network device name that will be associated with the device at the specified bus-address. The logical-name specified here can be used as a device name in network interface model definitions. (see Interface Models)
The type of port. supports "simple-port" and "multi-port"; only supports "simple-port"; other port types may be added in a future release.

PCI bus address of the port. Enclose the bus address in quotation marks so yaml does not misinterpret the embedded colon (:) characters. See Pre-Install Checklist - VLAN Info for details on how to determine this value.

Provides a list of attributes for the physical port. The current implementation supports only one attribute, "port-num", which is used to identify individual ports on network adapters that support more than one port on the same bus-address. See Pre-Install Checklist - VLAN Info for details on how to determine this value.
